title: Writing Down the Dragon: and Other Essays on the Tolkien Method and the Craft of Fantasy
description: Eleven essays on the works of J. R. R. Tolkien, written from the perspective of the working fantasy writer. How did Tolkien produce his effects, and what can we learn from his methods? In this collection, Tom Simon investigates topics from the uses of archaic language to the moral philosophy of Orcs.
author: Tom Simon
